title: Professional Development in Self-Regulated Learning Design Based on the 4C Framework

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Course for In-Service Secondary Teachers Focused on Fostering a Collaborative Learning Design Culture Through Self-Regulated Professional Development in Language Education

learning_goals: Learners can explain self-regulation strategies for each stage of the 4C Framework (Consume-Create-Connect-Contribute) with over 80% accuracy.

Learners can perform the Consume (analysis of existing materials) and Create (development of new designs) stages at least twice when designing actual language classes and write self-assessment reports.
Learners can practice Connect (collaboration with peer teachers) and Contribute (knowledge sharing) behaviors through online community activities at least once a week and collect peer feedback.
Learners can improve their self-regulated learning design competency to at least level 4 on a 5-level rubric by the end of the course.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
